name: Arch Linux
description: Arch Linux was first released in March 2002. It was created by Judd Vinet with the goal of providing a simple, lightweight, and flexible Linux distribution following the KISS (Keep It Simple, Stupid) principle.

sections.title: Features
sections.text: Arch Linux follows a rolling release model, meaning there are no fixed versionsâ€”users always have access to the latest software. It features the Pacman package manager and allows full system customization.

sections.title: Release Cycle
sections.text: Unlike traditional Linux distributions, Arch Linux does not have scheduled releases. Instead, it continuously updates, ensuring that users are always on the latest available versions of software.

sections.title: Community
sections.text: Arch Linux has a dedicated community known for its extensive documentation, including the Arch Wiki. The community actively maintains and develops the distribution, contributing to its packages and support forums.

sections.title: Current Status
sections.text: Arch Linux remains a favorite among advanced Linux users and enthusiasts who prefer a hands-on approach. It is widely used on personal computers, development environments, and even servers.
